channel.title: Is this server good?
channel.description:
Dual Intel E5620's 32GB RAM 2TB in RAID5
[IMG]http://i52.tinypic.com/na0pf.png[/img]

item.title: Is this server good?
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:395451”]“full root access over their shell”, so do they each have a shell account? (same OS, same server, different accounts) or are you running something like OpenVZ or Xen so that they run in a VPS?[/quote]Yeah its individual VPS’ for the regular Minecraft. We use Xen Paravirtualization and the OS we use with the Minecraft accounts is Ubuntu Server 10.04 LTS. For just VPS’ you can choose any of these (excluding the GNOME installs because they are still broken).

Read full topic

item.title: Is this server good?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“cumescape, post:7, topic:395451”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=492636.msg3602411#msg3602411 date=1305740168]
Do each of your customers have their own shell accounts (you let them run arbitrary code?) or do you just let them edit configuration files and have certain approved plugins they can use.

Also, if you don’t mind me asking, what kind of bandwidth do you use?
[/quote]With our budget hosting we let them use GameCP to control their server, all other Minecraft servers we give them full root access over their shell (and if they buy McMyAdmin they can control it from the web). As for the plugins you can upload any you like, we don’t limit that - but we do tell them its going to use alot more of their already far limited RAM (assuming you are on budget).

I believe our budget server is 1gbit.[/quote]
“full root access over their shell”, so do they each have a shell account? (same OS, same server, different accounts) or are you running something like OpenVZ or Xen so that they run in a VPS?

Read full topic

item.title: Is this server good?
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:5, topic:395451”]Do each of your customers have their own shell accounts (you let them run arbitrary code?) or do you just let them edit configuration files and have certain approved plugins they can use.

Also, if you don’t mind me asking, what kind of bandwidth do you use?[/quote]With our budget hosting we let them use GameCP to control their server, all other Minecraft servers we give them full root access over their shell (and if they buy McMyAdmin they can control it from the web). As for the plugins you can upload any you like, we don’t limit that - but we do tell them its going to use alot more of their already far limited RAM (assuming you are on budget).

I believe our budget server is 1gbit.

chri5:

How much and where from?

Can’t tell you how much, but iirc we are at colo4 with this server.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this server good?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You need every bit of it too, since the minecraft server is so poorly designed and executed. Do each of your customers have their own shell accounts (you let them run arbitrary code?) or do you just let them edit configuration files and have certain approved plugins they can use.

Also, if you don’t mind me asking, what kind of bandwidth do you use?

Read full topic

item.title: Is this server good?
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:3, topic:395451”]Those aren’t all being ran by the same user are they?[/quote]No I just needed to hide the names.

Edit: This server is used for our budget Minecraft hosting up to 512MB.

Read full topic
